text: Looks like some of the bubbles don't map to project locations (e.g. 69th street waste water treatment bubble is found near city hall.) Is that a data entry thing?
Defibrillators too, if they are to be made available city wide then it's hard to plot a point on the map for it. Right now it's in midtown somewhere, I think.
hey <@U061A5N1G>, i think it’s a source data thing. There were a bunch of projects with 901 Bagby as the address. I will clean that up.
I also did a little housecleaning, since the “Yorkshire” neighborhood mapped to England. The cross street “Nottingham” didn’t help

One thing I want to do is account for the ~200 CIP projects that are not mappable. There is a ton of technology $$ allocated, including $61k for “citizen engagement software” that could present “revenue opportunities” (say what?)
thanks for the feedback and I’ll check up on those city hall projects
<@U061A5N1G>: i went through and made all of the lat/lons more accurate. please have another look when you get a moment and let me know your feedback! :slightly_smiling_face:
